result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffery S Boucher

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeffery S Boucher in court with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Elizabeth Kiel.
Upon plea Ct 2 in 13CF1415-w/held sent, 18 mos prob; 90 days RCJ with huber, no alc/cs-UA's, AODA/ft, counseling, FT emp. Ct 1 is DRI as would 14CF1157. Deft will plead to 13TR17628, $887.50, 6 mos dlr and any other sanctions DOT may impose. The balance of the TR's are DRI.
P-G to both
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT - State stipulates
The State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

Defense agrees with the recommendation of the State with the exception of the jail time. Defense asks for 45 days RCJ with 45 days stayed.

BTC: guilty as above. Balance are DRI. In 13CF1415, sent w/held - 18 mos probation. 
         13TR17628, $887.50, 6 mo DLR, AODA

Conditions:
90 days RCJ/3 days CFTS- Huber is granted for employment. Do not report in late or under the influence of alc/cs
       REPORT IN 
Defendant may serve in Milwaukee County.

obey all rules and regs
costs - 60 dtp
DNA unless already provided & costs
If provided, no costs
no alc/cs except by Rx-UA's
any counseling deemed approp by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and follow through
Ft emp
do not associate with any known users of illegal substances
FAW/vote

IS eligible for CIP and ERP

Defendant Jeffery S Boucher in court with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense is asking for another 2 months as deft is in an intensive outpatient treatment and wishes to allow deft to complete same. The State withdraws the offer if the matter is going to be set for trial. 
Defense agrees to COP  Plea hearing scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 09:30 am.
from Atty requesting adj. No objection by the State
Status conference on March 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Status conference scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Atty Schoenfeldt req adj of PTC off record - no objection by ADA Repischak
Pre-trial conference on October 24, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

Defendant Jeffery S Boucher in court with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  Robert S. Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.
  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Department Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 3:00 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 24, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Preliminary hearing on September 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeffery S Boucher in court with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  Robert S. Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Complaint received by defense. Reading waived. The State asks for $1,000.00 signature bond. Defense does not object

BTC: $1000.00 signature bond. Same conditions as 13CF1415  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.
